Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the cost of the Mickelsen Safeguard Complex by stating it cost $6 billion instead of the actual cost of around $5.7 billion.
Understate: The claim understates the operational period of the complex by stating it was only operational for one day, while it remained operational until Feb. 10, 1976.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that the complex was only operational for one day or that it was a possible headquarters for the illuminati.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the government spent $6 billion on the complex without providing any evidence or justification for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the complex's operational period or its purpose, such as the agreement reached with Russia to limit ABM sites.
